title: Linda Hoffmans New Book The House at Mingo Pond is the Story of What Happens When Secrets are Exposed
text:
Recent release “The House at Mingo Pond” from Page Publishing author Linda Hoffman is the story of the strength and courage of three families to try and save a boy from his sadistic and psychotic mother.
(PRWEB) October 08, 2015
Linda Hoffman, a floral designer, avid traveler, and the author of “He Can’t Remember, She Can’t Forget”, has completed her next book “The House at Mingo Pond”: a gripping and fascinating look at what happens when mysteries are brought out into the open.
Four families live by the house at Mingo Pond. One of those families is shrouded in secrecy. When the veil of secrecy is ripped down, it takes the bravery of the others to try and save a boy from his cruel mother. Her tortured past drove her to kill. Now her insanity is driving her to kill again.
Published by New York City-based Page Publishing, Hoffman’s poignant tale “The House at Mingo Pond” is the tale of a home that holds secrets: dark secrets from the past and horrific secrets in the present.
Readers who wish to experience this mesmerizing work can purchase “The House at Mingo Pond” at bookstores everywhere, or online at the Apple iTunes store, Amazon, Google Play or Barnes and Noble.
For additional information or media inquiries, contact Page Publishing at 866-315-2708.
About Page Publishing
Page Publishing is a traditional New York based full-service publishing house that handles all of the intricacies involved in publishing its authors’ books, including distribution in the world’s largest retail outlets and royalty generation. Page Publishing knows that authors need to be free to create - not bogged down with complicated business issues like eBook conversion, establishing wholesale accounts, insurance, shipping, taxes and the like. Its roster of authors can leave behind these tedious, complex and time consuming issues, and focus on their passion: writing and creating. Learn more at http://www.pagepublishing.com .
